CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.PR_PROC: Negotiated without a prior call for competition

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Air Support, C17 Command Support and Airborne Equipment Project Team (CSAE PT)

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Air Support, C17 Command Support and Airborne Equipment Project Team (CSAE PT)

TITLE.P: Procurement of Blue Buoys for Use within Airborne Equipment VTN

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of new blue buoys to refresh the in-service stock, as used within Airborne Delivery Equipment (ADE) stores parachuting systems.

This contract is to meet the requirements of the Air Support C17CSAE PT to provide Blue Fender Buoys to support the delivery of Airborne Delivery Equipment (ADE). These buoys provide flotation for several ADE airdrop platforms including but not limited to: Light Stores, SPAD, PURIBAD and MMP.

Other providers would therefore be unable to provide the equipment without the requisite safety assurances which would result in disproportionate technical difficulties, as well as a gap in capability. The contract may therefore only be awarded to this particular economic operator as Zodiac MilPro Ltd is the only company able to fulfil the full requirement.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: 2 x 1-year contract extension options are included in the contract to allow for the contract to be extended until March 2024 if required.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The C17 Command Support and Airborne Equipment Delivery Team (C17CSAE DT), as part of the UK Ministry of Defence (MOD), has a requirement to procure new items to refresh the in-service stock. The equipment type required includes specific flotation buoys to be used within Airborne Delivery Equipment (ADE) stores parachuting systems.

It is intended to award a new contract up to the value of 323 000 GBP excluding VAT for the core period of the contract with Zodiac MilPro Ltd. It is intended this contract be let until 31.3.2022 with options to extend by 2 extensions each of 1 year, with a total potential extension of 2 additional years. The value of the option years has been estimated at a maximum of 85 000 GBP ex-VAT for option year FY22/23 and a maximum of 190 000 GBP ex-VAT for option year FY23/24, for a total absolute maximum value of 600 000 GBP excluding VAT if both options are taken.

It has been determined that this contract can be placed using the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a contract notice pursuant to Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(ii) of the UK Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011) for technical reasons. In-service airdrop parachute systems utilise the specific equipment component parts to be procured under this contract, and these systems have all been extensively trialled for airworthiness clearance. No other equipment types are therefore deemed technically compatible or safe for use within the in-service systems. Zodiac MilPro are deemed by the Type airworthiness authority (TAA) to be the only approved supplier of the specific flotation buoys that meets the safety and airworthiness requirements to provide the equipment to the cleared specification. Zodiac MilPro Ltd holds proprietary information, in the form of the documentation setting out the manufacture of the equipment, which is unavailable to other economic operators. Other providers would therefore be unable to replicate the system with certainty or provide the requisite safety assurances. The contract may therefore only be awarded to this particular economic operator.

For these reasons, the specialist skills, know-how and technical information required, this equipment would not be available from an alternative supplier. As a result, Zodiac MilPro Ltd is the only company able to fulfil the requirement that is being pursued by the authority.

TITLE.P: Procurement of Blue Buoys for use within Airborne Equipment

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Penrice House, Bailey Court, Felinfach, Swansea West Business Park

INFO_ADD.P: The authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a security aspects letter), the authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
